intro: Pimelea filamentosa, commonly known as the silky pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to thrive in coastal and sandy environments.
